questions.question: Which Windows system provides the operator interface in ICS?
questions.explanation: HMI workstations on Windows provide graphical interface for operators.

questions.question: Why is ICS Windows patching complex?
questions.explanation: Patches can break certified configs, void support, and require testing.

questions.question: What is application whitelisting?
options: Allow only pre-approved applications, block all others
questions.explanation: Only approved executables can run - very effective for fixed ICS environments.

questions.question: Security concern with AD in ICS?
options: Compromised credentials give access across OT network
questions.explanation: Compromised AD (especially domain admin) can access all domain-joined ICS systems.

questions.question: How to handle legacy Windows (XP) in ICS?
options: Isolate with strict segmentation and compensating controls
questions.explanation: Isolate legacy systems, add compensating controls, and plan migration.

questions.question: Group Policy can enforce security settings across ICS Windows systems.
questions.explanation: True. GPOs centrally manage security settings on domain-joined systems.

questions.question: What should be disabled to reduce attack surface?
questions.explanation: Disable unused services, PowerShell (if not needed), Remote Desktop, etc.

questions.question: Windows Event ID for successful logon?
Purpose of Historian server?
options: Collect and store time-series process data
questions.explanation: Historians store process data for trending, analysis, and compliance.

questions.question: Why is USB control important in ICS?
options: Can introduce malware and exfiltrate data
questions.explanation: USB was Stuxnet's vector; controls prevent malware and data theft.

questions.question: What is a golden ticket attack?
options: Forged Kerberos ticket for persistent domain access
questions.explanation: Forging Kerberos tickets using stolen KRBTGT hash grants persistent access.

questions.question: Windows Defender can be part of ICS defense-in-depth.
questions.explanation: True, when tested for compatibility and combined with other controls.

questions.question: Best practice for admin accounts in ICS?
options: Separate accounts for IT/OT with minimal privileges
questions.explanation: Separate IT/OT admin accounts, least privilege, tiered administration.

questions.question: What does WSUS stand for?
questions.explanation: WSUS enables internal management and testing of Windows updates.

questions.question: Why minimize ICS internet connectivity?
options: Reduces exposure to internet threats and unauthorized access
questions.explanation: No direct internet reduces web attacks, phishing, and unauthorized remote access.
